result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew W Blauvelt

records.addlTxt:
8:36 AM Defendant Matthew W Blauvelt in court.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by zoom audio for Matthew W Blauvelt.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Frank states they  have requested discovery in this matter and has not yet received it.  Atty Frank requests a further status hearing to have all discovery and time to review. 
State has put in a request for further discovery in this matter.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:08 AM Defendant Matthew W Blauvelt in court.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Matthew W Blauvelt.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Frank updates the court as to the status of the matter and requests discovery in this matter.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:05 AM Defendant Matthew W Blauvelt in court.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Matthew W Blauvelt.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Frank requests additional discovery in this matter.  
State will send offer that is in the file.
Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:16 AM Defendant Matthew W Blauvelt in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Town of Oconomowoc Police Department Officer Andrew Preisler sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Campbell.  Cross examination by Attorney Frank.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Frank objects to bind over with argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:22 PM Defendant Matthew W Blauvelt appeared by Zoom with attorney Ryan T. Frank who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.    Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Petition for Leave to file additional motions, filed by Atty Ryan Frank. Sent to CC Herring for review

Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant states he can post the cash bail.  Court sets a status of counsel date this Friday and will allow the defendant to appear by zoom.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
